instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is 3V3_S0SW_LCD? 3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. This is necessary to get an image on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   no image / no backlight
threads.message:
The board powers on.   The <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> will flash 3.3v only for a moment 1/2 sec and then it goes away.
I have traced this back to the <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> signal which also only flashes on for a split second.  

Comparing against my test board this should stay on even with a panel not connected for some time.
I diode checked the data lines to the CPU and did not find any damaged lines.

I am really lost here.

Board enters S0 state.   Appears to turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   no image / no backlight
threads.message:
Did you check USB activity and external video?
Do you note pulse at <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> at same time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   no image / no backlight
threads.message:
no data activity at   <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> 
external USB drive does light up

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   no image / no backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> must be checked for DC level; there is no data.
But can only appear when <SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> is present.
That's the reason I said to check for pulse.

USB drive activity LED flashes, or gets steady (power) light only???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   no image / no backlight
threads.message:
not even a twitch on the scope. 
light only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   no image / no backlight
threads.message:
Then the board gets stuck, not really boots.
There is not just a video issue.

Did you try DFU?
